CatDescriptText: Other protest signs picketers are carrying read "I'm Mad Too" and "Support This Boycott Today For Dignity Tomorrow". Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 24, 1967, pg. 1, reads: "Hot in Streets - William "Bouie" Haden, head of the militant United Movement for Progress, staged a noisy one-man demonstration at Homewood's Giant Eagle store which resulted in the supermarket chain agreeing to place a Negro manager in one of its stores by Sept. 30. Above, Haden taunts a Negro customer entering the store. Although some Negroes crossed the picket line, many by-passed the store. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men, including William "Bouie" Haden in center, and women, picketing in front of Giant Eagle grocery store, with signs that read "Seek Honor, You'll Not Find That Here, Keep Moving," Homewood
